intro: Dunalia acnistoides, commonly known as the clustered milkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and attract various pollinators. Dunalia acnistoides is often found in grasslands and woodland edges, thriving in well-drained soils.
